metadata.synopsis: Naaber's dialog at Carmen's Cosmetics Shop in Wyrm's Crossing. He's very annoying and going through his entire dialog will give you an experience reward.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and talk to Naaber S_LOW_Figaros_Naaber_fa22f4a3-53ba-4a35-9dec-a402244a5203

54.speaker: Naaber
54.text: Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy biiiiiiirthday dear...

53.speaker: Naaber
53.text: What do you think? Am I a good bard?

230.speaker: Player
230.text: All the bards I've met play an instrument.

225.speaker: Naaber
225.text: Oh. I don't have one of those. Balls. Back to the Naabing board, then...

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You were great! Keep at it!

179.speaker: Naaber
179.text: You're humouring me again, aren't you? Oh well... back to the Naabing board.

37.speaker: Naaber
37.text: Oh... sorry - shit. I didn't know bards had to bake too...

224.speaker: Player
224.text: I'd cut out your tongue, but I want to know you've inflicted this misery on the rest of the city.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: What is it this time? Bard?

99.speaker: Naaber
99.text: Yep! That's right! Help me out here. Happy biiiiiirthday deeeeear...

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I was sculpted from a slice of Bhaal's own dead flesh. I have no birthday.

61.speaker: Naaber
61.text: It isn't? Shoot. What did you think, anyway?

91.speaker: Naaber
91.text: Could I be a good bard?

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Sing your name in a long, high, operatic tone.

147.speaker: Naaber
147.text: Wooooooow. That was so much better than I'll ever be.

153.speaker: Naaber
153.text: Wooooooow. That was so much better than I'll ever be.

32.text: Oof. Is that what good sounds like? Gross.

152.speaker: Naaber
152.text: Oof. Is that what good sounds like? Gross.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Shut up shut up shut up.

64.speaker: Naaber
64.text: Haha! Why would I do that?

181.speaker: Naaber
181.text: Come on - play along now. Haaaaaappy biiiiiirthday deeeear...

71.speaker: Naaber
71.text: Perhaps the answer was deep within me all along... an ancient spark of arcana... Yes, I was born to be a sorcerer, I can feel it.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Cool, can you do any magic?

11.speaker: Naaber
11.text: Let me focus... I can feel the power deep within me... it's coming up! It's coming up!

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Does your magic also come from the beating heart of the storm?

264.speaker: Player
264.text: Bhaal said I would go mad... is it happening already? Is this idiot my tormenter?

253.speaker: Player
253.text: Why do I keep talking to this idiot? Why? Why?

148.speaker: Naaber
148.text: Oh - you meant me. Haha, good one!

256.speaker: Naaber
256.text: Am I boring you? I feel like I'm boring you.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: I take it you've decided to try being a monk?

87.speaker: Naaber
87.text: I'm going to be the best monk there ever was!

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Go back to being silent, then.

97.speaker: Naaber
97.text: What are you talking about? I can shut up whenever I want!

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *Naaber seals his lips, but you feel the pressure of words behind them. The poor thing is straining fit to burst.*

98.speaker: Naaber
98.text: Aaaaaaargh! Ican'tdoitIhavetoomuchtosay! You were right. I can't be a monk. I just want to TALK. Talking's great, see? You can say words, make friends, tell everyone everything you're thinking and feeling...

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *As he empties himself of his latest slew of thoughts, you take the opportunity to slip away.*

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I doubt you'll find peace, but the rest of us might. If we're lucky.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Are we still not done yet?

41.speaker: Naaber
41.text: Oh HI! I didn't see you there! I was in deep meditation, see.

83.speaker: Naaber
83.text: Isn't peace and quiet just the best?

45.speaker: Naaber
45.text: I've decided to be a monk!

122.speaker: Naaber
122.text: My liege. I swear to you an undying oath of absolute devotion. I am but your humble paladin.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Use HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_Bows_Kneel_01 to show Naaber kneeling.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: My only command is that you never speak to me again.

169.speaker: Naaber
169.text: I'M SORRY I CAN'T DO IT I'M JUST TOO EXCITED TO TALK TO YOU.

127.speaker: Naaber
127.text: Oh. Oh. Oh no... Something inside me feels very wrong...

57.speaker: Naaber
57.text: Did I just break something? I hope it wasn't anything important. Ha... ha...
57.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter at the end

27.speaker: Naaber
27.text: Really? But... I'm ready to do anything.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Then you must follow my commands. My first is this - break your oath. Now.

187.speaker: Naaber
187.text: But I - How am I supposed to -

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I am afraid I am sworn to an oath of my own. I cannot be your master.

144.speaker: Naaber
144.text: Oh well. BACK TO THE NAABING BOARD.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: I have done many terrible things, but I regret none more than listening to you.

9.speaker: Naaber
9.text: But... you're the one who keeps talking to me.

111.speaker: Naaber
111.text: I - I don't want to - all right. An oath's an oath, I suppose...

105.speaker: Naaber
105.text: I can swear a different oath if you like? Come baaaaaack!

129.speaker: Naaber
129.text: Bless us with your gentle - no, holy - spirit - no, soul - no, spirit... your powers - your divine powers... bother.
129.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

108.speaker: Player
108.text: What happened to being a bard? I thought you were enjoying that?

3.speaker: Naaber
3.text: Felt a bit lowbrow for Naaber. What's a bard going to do, sing at you? Hah!

166.speaker: Naaber
166.text: No, I've decided I'm going to be a cleric. Now if you'll excuse me, I must pray.

232.speaker: Naaber
232.text: Our holy - um - most holy - sacrilege - heretic? GOD. Bless us. Please?

2.speaker: Naaber
2.text: Wait, no! Come back! I haven't blessed you yet!

161.speaker: Player
161.text: Whatever you're doing, I'm pretty sure you're doing it wrong.

88.speaker: Naaber
88.text: I'm praying. Is that not how it goes?

221.speaker: Player
221.text: What god are you praying to?

191.speaker: Player
191.text: It's more like... By your sacrament ever be praised. Oh holy, most wise, eternal god...

5.speaker: Naaber
5.text: Wooooooow. That was awesome! I bet it even works when you do it.

156.speaker: Naaber
156.text: You're very good at this! Perhaps you can teach me. I'm trying to pray.

149.speaker: Naaber
149.text: But why? We're having so much fun!

136.speaker: Naaber
136.text: If not a rogue, then a ranger. I'm great at chasing things down.
136.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I hope you're looking forward to those long, lonely months on the trail.

118.speaker: Naaber
118.text: Godsdammit, why are so many adventurer jobs so lonely?! I thought you were supposed to have parties?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Look! A displacer beast! Go after it!

203.speaker: Naaber
203.text: Wait a minute... you were pulling my leg! Haha! Good one! But you're not getting rid of old Naaber that easily.

52.speaker: Naaber
52.text: I am a bit too chatty, aren't I? Haha. OH WELL.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You're great at nothing. In fact, you're the worst person I've ever met.

26.speaker: Naaber
26.text: Oh pish! I'm great at being your friend. And that's all that matters! Friendship! Yay!

146.speaker: Naaber
146.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

262.speaker: Naaber
262.text: Your fists, silly! I'm trying something out.

139.speaker: Naaber
139.text: My name's Naaber, adventurer-to-be, soon to be the best adventurer anyone's ever seen.

60.speaker: Naaber
60.text: As soon as I figure out what kind of adventurer I'm going to be... What do you think? Could I be a fighter?

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Why don't you actually fight me and I'll tell you?

206.speaker: Naaber
206.text: Um - sure. I'll just... raise my fists and...

186.speaker: Naaber
186.text: Urgh. It's no use. I can't do it.

100.speaker: Naaber
100.text: Guess old Naaber's more of a talker than a fighter.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Here's a tip to get you started - less talking, more fighting.

43.speaker: Naaber
43.text: Right you are! I'll just... find something to punch... I guess...

190.speaker: Naaber
190.text: It won't hurt, will it? No, surely not...

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Follow your dreams and find out.

158.speaker: Naaber
158.text: Phew. I was hoping you'd say that. To tell you the truth, I don't actually like hurting people very much. Or getting hurt.

51.speaker: Naaber
51.text: It's a good job I ran into you!

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I think you're not even worth being sacrificed to Lord Bhaal.

238.speaker: Naaber
238.text: Oh. All right, then! Sorry to bother you!

218.speaker: Player
218.text: I could not give less of a shit.

6.speaker: Naaber
6.text: Yay! You spoke to me! Nobody ever talks to me.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: It's pronounced 'grovel afore me or die'.

130.speaker: Naaber
130.text: Wait! I wasn't really going to fight you! I was just trying something out!

175.speaker: Naaber
175.text: Know any fiendish philanthropists? Fickle fae financiers? Eldritch employers? I want to make a pact.
175.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Are you sure you're ready to be a warlock? To sell your soul for eternity?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: My patron might still be in the market for souls. I'll put in a good word for you.

126.speaker: Naaber
126.text: My soul? I have to give up my soul to become a warlock?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Here's a pact for you. Give up.

254.speaker: Naaber
254.text: That's not a pact. That's just an order... Oh-ho! Very good! You nearly had me there!

234.speaker: Player
234.text: No pact needed. I hope a devil finds you and takes you straight to the Hells.

142.speaker: Naaber
142.text: Awwww, that's so nice of you to say! Thanks! I hope so too! Bet it's really warm there.

235.speaker: Naaber
235.text: Please don't leave! I don't want to be alone.

226.speaker: Naaber
226.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

150.speaker: Player
150.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

20.speaker: Player
20.text: What in the hells are you doing now?
20.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

92.speaker: Naaber
92.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

65.speaker: Naaber
65.text: I'm pretending to be a dog. Everyone likes dogs!
65.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I liked you more as a human.
63.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

109.speaker: Player
109.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

233.speaker: Naaber
233.text: That's not true! My mum does. Wait no, she loves me, but does she actually like me...?
233.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

231.speaker: Player
231.text: An admirable pursuit. Those creatures understand the true meaning of life.

176.speaker: Naaber
176.text: Ah ha! You fell for it!

249.speaker: Naaber
249.text: Wait, come back! I was only pretending!

247.speaker: Naaber
247.text: BOO! Bet you didn't even see me coming. I'm a shadow, a master of sneakery. A rogue.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Was someone talking? I hear them, but I can't see them!

182.speaker: Naaber
182.text: Oooooh I might be too good at this. What if no one ever sees me again?!

113.speaker: Naaber
113.text: What if no one ever talks to me again?! NOOOOOOOO!

17.speaker: Player
17.text: No, you're not. I see you. You're right there.

29.speaker: Naaber
29.text: Oh thank goodness. I was worried I was getting too good at it and nobody would ever see me again.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Are you ready for the long, drawn-out silences of an assassin's pursuit?

15.speaker: Naaber
15.text: Why do so many professions have to be done in silence?!

242.speaker: Naaber
242.text: I LIKE TALKING. TALKING IS THE BEST.

266.speaker: Player
266.text: You are a pain in the arse, that's what you are.

248.speaker: Naaber
248.text: You're joking, right? Because that's what friends do?

236.speaker: Naaber
236.text: Ha ha ha! Very good! And you're a pain in the arm!

243.speaker: Narrator
243.text: *A faint, muffled squeak accompanies your departure - Naaber, trying to stop himself from giving away his position.*

252.speaker: Naaber
252.text: Behold, mundane meddler. You step in the domain of a master speller. For I am to be a most mighty WIZARD.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: I know this one. You're a wizard.

102.speaker: Naaber
102.text: Wizard. W - I - Z - A - R - D. Wizard.

36.speaker: Naaber
36.text: That wasn't it, was it? Bum.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: No, spell. As in magic spell. The thing wizards cast.

22.speaker: Naaber
22.text: Wait, there's another step after that? Rats.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Show me what you can do.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: That's spelling. Wizards cast spells. Idiot.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: How wondrous. What school of magic is your specialty?

135.speaker: Player
135.text: I regret ever talking to you.

258.speaker: Naaber
258.text: Oh. Oh. That hurts, you know?

18.speaker: Naaber
18.text: But we can still be friends, right? Right?

80.speaker: Naaber
80.text: Yaaaaay! Friends! This is the best day of Naaber's life.

12.speaker: Naaber
12.text: Wait, wait! I promise I won't turn you into a flumph! I literally don't know how!

261.speaker: Naaber
261.text: These roles sure are restrictive, aren't they? Maybe the adventuring life's just not for me.

188.speaker: Naaber
188.text: I really like talking to you. There's not a lot of people that want to talk to me so I bought you a present. Here.

189.speaker: Naaber
189.text: Now what are we going to talk about if not about the adventuring life?

19.speaker: Naaber
19.text: Wait wait. What if I mix the classes... Oh Naaber, you GENIUS!

265.speaker: Naaber
265.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

251.speaker: Naaber
251.text: Are you scared? Did you wet your pants? Did you? Did you?
251.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Let me guess, you've decided to try being a barbarian?
33.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

58.speaker: Naaber
58.text: That's right! You got it! Oh yay!

204.speaker: Naaber
204.text: So how did I do? Are you quaking in your boots with fear?

44.speaker: Player
44.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

239.speaker: Player
239.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: My piss lies dormant, but my gorge rises.
106.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: My bladder control is exemplary, I'm afraid.
95.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

132.speaker: Player
132.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

227.speaker: Naaber
227.text: YES! Naaber has found his calling!
227.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

267.speaker: Naaber
267.text: YES! Naaber has found his calling!
267.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

201.speaker: Naaber
201.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

76.text: You're very kind, but I can tell that you're humouring me. Everyone's always humouring me. *Sigh.*

49.speaker: Naaber
49.text: You're very kind, but I can tell that you're humouring me. Everyone's always humouring me. *Sigh.*

0.speaker: Naaber
0.text: Oh wow, yours is much better.

14.speaker: Naaber
14.text: Oh wow, yours is much better.

170.speaker: Naaber
170.text: Oh well. Back to the Naabing board!

241.text: Oh wow, that sounds awful. I don't think I want to sound like that.

237.speaker: Naaber
237.text: Oh wow, that sounds awful. I don't think I want to sound like that.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You don't know when to shut up, do you?

7.speaker: Naaber
7.text: So what do you say - did I scare ya?

205.speaker: Naaber
205.text: Wait! I didn't mean to scare you off! Come back!
